subject: Communication
title: The Pause: Stimulus and Response
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Pause: Stimulus and Response usable.

hook.text: Viktor Frankl wrote: 'Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our freedom and power to choose.'

buildup.text: The pause is the foundational skill of self-regulation. It's the moment between what happens to you and what you do.

discovery.text: Neuroscience confirms: the prefrontal cortex needs about 6 seconds to fully engage after an amygdala trigger.

twist.text: Most regrettable actions happen in the first 3 seconds ‚Äî before the thinking brain has a chance to weigh in.

climax.text: Techniques: count to ten, take three deep breaths, name the emotion silently.

punchline.text: Freedom isn't in the stimulus or the response. It's in the pause between them.

quiz.question: How long does the prefrontal cortex need to fully engage after an emotional trigger?
